column5: Went out of the bluffs sat and put in about 9hrs on the water. Fishing was hit and miss, bait was nowhere to be found but we kept searching until we hit some fish. Caught three majors on flies and meat anywhere from 120-330 feet of water.     Last fish was pushin 30, snapped a rod holder on my rigger when it took off!
any salmon from pier yet??  lol
Anyone know a good place to buy marshmallows? LMAO!  Nice fish man!
Tis August. I'd almost forgot.  Edit to add that those are some nice salmon.
Nice Biggins.  What lb test on the rod that broke the holder? Look at the size of the mouth on the last one. Thanks for putting the pics up.
Judging from the colour of those fish, anytime...
What a beast of a fish that second one is!! WTG!! Looks like there coming around.
Thanks guys, 65 lb braid mainline and 50lb flouro Fish was third as of this morning in gosd. Couldnt weigh it yesterday.
Those are some nice chinnies. The first one looks like it,s ready for the river run.
Nice Kings there Gallie. Thx for posting.

For sure. We did awesome last night off the pier in port credit. Glow spoons produced 9 mature kings from low to upper 20's pre & post dusk. Heading back tonite. Stop by and say high. I'll be the guy with the family bag of marshmallows. Lots to share  Was that you? Shoot man, I was the guy just down from you with the Coleman stove going. After you left they turned onto foam rubber ear plugs in a big way. We got six and the last one broke our net.  But sorry for the threat hijack, all. Gallie ... very nice fish. That last one is a tank.
beauty fish, and well earned that's a long days hunt.
Those are some big berthas...hard work payed off
